name: 62 people,
description:
From the unique team of Austin Stone and Austin Manche, '62 people' is an action puzzle game set in a postapocalyptic future where technology has advanced so far that rescue teams can just as easily find themselves trapped in '62 people's homes as they are in '62 people's houses' - together with their friends and family.
The premise of '62 people' is simple - two teams of players compete to find each other's homes and solve puzzles whilst constantly experiencing various deadly scenarios. '62 people' will be available until the end of 2016 for PC, Mac and Linux. '62 people' is the brainchild of Outhouse Media and has been developed by Austin Stone (Austin Stone, 'Quantum Break'), Austin Manche (Artefact 3D, 'SCA: [The] Skills of Champions'), Troy Saing (Thunderstone, 'Mechanix'), Mikene Croisette (ESRB, 'Mass Effect'), Nick Cross (Gangnam Style), and Ryan Cole (Quantic Dream, 'Fate/stay night'). A huge Thanks goes to Bill Diamond for the professional video editing.
